remixlab.dandelion.branch

Class MotionAgent<A extends Action<Constants.MotionAction>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.bias.core.Agent
      • remixlab.bias.branch.GenericAgent
        • remixlab.bias.branch.GenericMotionAgent
          • remixlab.dandelion.branch.MotionAgent<A>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - Motion Action used the parameterize the agent. It defines the maximum degrees-of-freedom (DOFs) that the agent supports. See TrackballAgent, WheeledMouseAgent, JoystickAgent and HIDAgent.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HIDAgent, JoystickAgent, TrackballAgent, WheeledMouseAgent

    public abstract class MotionAgent<A extends Action<Constants.MotionAction>>
extends GenericMotionAgent
    The root of all dandelion motion agents (which may have a wheel), such as a mouse or a touch-screen. This agent specializes in handling GenericFrame objects, but it can also handle third-party Grabber or GenericGrabber object instances. In the latter case, third-parties should implement their own MotionBranches.

    The agent has two branches of the type MotionBranch<MotionAction, A, ClickAction> to handle GenericFrame object instances: eyeBranch(), for Constants.Target.EYE (which typically has one one single instance, that of the GrabberScene.eyeFrame()); and frameBranch(), for Constants.Target.FRAME (which may have several instances, see addGrabber(Grabber)). Note that through the aforementioned branches the following agent Profiles are available: eyeProfile(), frameProfile(), eyeClickProfile() and frameClickProfile(). Refer to the Branch and Profile for details.

    'Interaction customization', i.e., binding motion and click event shortcuts (see MotionShortcut) to dandelion click and motion actions, may be achieved through those profiles or through various of the high-level methods conveniently provided by this agent, such as #setBinding(Target, ClickShortcut, ClickAction), #setBinding(Target, ClickShortcut, ClickAction), and so on. Note that all those methods take a Constants.Target parameter type which actually denotes the profile the agent should target.

    The agent's Agent.defaultGrabber() is the GrabberScene.eye() frame (see Eye.frame()) (note that resetDefaultGrabber() will thus defaults to the eye frame too).

    See Also:
    Constants.MotionAction, Constants.ClickAction

      • eyeBranch

        public MotionBranch<Constants.MotionAction,A,Constants.ClickAction> eyeBranch()

        A is the (Action<MotionAction>) used to parameterize the agent. See TrackballAgent, WheeledMouseAgent, JoystickAgent and HIDAgent.

      • frameBranch

      • setBinding

        public void setBinding(Constants.Target target,
                       MotionShortcut shortcut,
                       A action)
        Defines a motion-shortcut binding for the target interactive-frame. Same as motionProfile(target).setBinding(shortcut, action).

        The target may be either (Constants.Target.EYE to point out the GrabberScene.eyeFrame(), or Constants.Target.FRAME to specify the remaining interactive-frames.

        See Also:
        #motionProfile(Target)
